page.title: 03MANOR HOUSE MARSTON MAGNA.
page.content: The Manor House was built in 1613 facing north to avoid the obnoctious vapours of the plague.The walls are made of ham stone.The windows are held in place by lead.The roof is made of normal tiles and has three chimneys. There are three main rooms on the ground floor.In one room there is a cabinet with five guns inside.The house is haunted by a green lady who is said to have been exorcized. Mr.Illingsworth, who lives in this house, is a retired Rear Admiral.He joined the navy at the age of 13 and stayed with them for 45 years.He was partly responsible for the development of harriers at Yeovilton.He has six children and eleven grand children. He is a very busy man as he belongs to 13 different groups and likes to help the village people. One of his duties is to wind the church clock.
